Theme

The Theme system provides a centralized way to manage design tokens and styling across your application. It uses React Context to provide theme values to all components.

Overview​

The theme system consists of:

  • ThemeProvider: A context provider that wraps your app and supplies theme values
  • useTheme: A hook to access theme values in your components
  • createTheme: A function to create custom themes with overrides
  • Design Tokens: Colors (primitive and semantic), spacing, typography, shadows, and radius values

Setup​

Wrap your application with ThemeProvider:

import { ThemeProvider } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider>
      {/* Your app components */}
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}

Using the Theme​

Access theme values using the useTheme hook:

import { useTheme } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

function MyComponent() {
  const { colors, spacing, typography, radius, shadows } = useTheme();

  return (
    <View style={{
      backgroundColor: colors.background,
      padding: spacing.md,
      borderRadius: radius.md,
    }}>
      <Text style={typography.header.large.bold}>
        Hello World
      </Text>
    </View>
  );
}

Creating Custom Themes​

Use createTheme to create a custom theme with partial overrides:

import { createTheme, ThemeProvider } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

const customTheme = createTheme({
  mode: 'dark',
  colors: {
    primary: '#FF6B6B',
    secondary: '#4ECDC4',
    background: '#1A1A1A',
    surface: '#2D2D2D',
    text: '#FFFFFF',
  },
  spacing: {
    md: 20,
  },
});

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider value={customTheme}>
      {/* Your app */}
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}

createTheme Function​

The createTheme function allows you to create a theme by merging your custom values with the default theme. It accepts a partial Theme object, so you only need to override the values you want to change.

Signature:

createTheme(overrides?: Partial<Theme>): Theme

Parameters:

  • overrides (optional): A partial theme object containing only the values you want to override

Returns:

  • A complete Theme object with your overrides merged into the default theme

Example:

import { createTheme } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

// Create a dark theme
const darkTheme = createTheme({
  mode: 'dark',
  colors: {
    background: '#000000',
    surface: '#1A1A1A',
    text: '#FFFFFF',
    primary: '#4ECDC4',
  },
});

// Create a theme with custom spacing
const compactTheme = createTheme({
  spacing: {
    sm: 4,
    md: 12,
    lg: 20,
  },
});

Theme Structure​

The theme object has the following structure:

interface Theme {
  mode: 'light' | 'dark';
  colors: SemanticColors;
  spacing: Spacing;
  radius: Radius;
  shadows: Shadows;
  typography: Typography;
}

Colors​

The theme system uses two types of colors: Primitive Colors and Semantic Colors.

Primitive Colors​

Primitive colors are the raw color palette available in the design system. These are organized by color families with shades from 50 (lightest) to 900 (darkest).

Available Color Families:

  • transparent - Transparent color
  • black - #000000
  • white - #FFFFFF
  • slate - Gray-blue tones (50-900)
  • gray - Neutral grays (50-900)
  • zinc - Cool grays (50-900)
  • red - Red tones (50-900)
  • orange - Orange tones (50-900)
  • yellow - Yellow tones (50-900)
  • green - Green tones (50-900)
  • teal - Teal/cyan-green tones (50-900)
  • cyan - Cyan tones (50-900)
  • blue - Blue tones (50-900)
  • indigo - Indigo tones (50-900)
  • violet - Violet tones (50-900)
  • pink - Pink tones (50-900)

Usage:

import { colors } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

// Access primitive colors
colors.blue[500]  // '#3B82F6'
colors.red[600]   // '#DC2626'
colors.gray[100]  // '#F3F4F6'

Color Scale: Each color family has shades from 50 to 900:

  • 50 - Lightest shade (backgrounds, subtle highlights)
  • 100 - Very light
  • 200 - Light
  • 300 - Lighter
  • 400 - Medium-light
  • 500 - Base color (most commonly used)
  • 600 - Medium-dark
  • 700 - Darker
  • 800 - Very dark
  • 900 - Darkest shade (text, strong accents)

Semantic Colors​

Semantic colors represent the meaning and purpose of colors in your UI. They provide a consistent way to use colors across your application.

Base Colors:

  • background - Main background color (#FFFFFF)
  • surface - Surface/container background (#F2F2F7)
  • card - Card background (#F2F2F7)
  • border - Border color (#C6C6C8)
  • divider - Divider line color (#C6C6C8)

Text Colors:

  • text - Primary text color (#000000)
  • textSecondary - Secondary text color (#6D6D70)
  • textDisabled - Disabled text color (#C7C7CC)
  • placeholder - Placeholder text color (#C7C7CC)

Brand Colors:

  • primary - Primary brand color (#005ce6)
  • primaryText - Text color on primary background (#FFFFFF)
  • secondary - Secondary brand color (#5856D6)
  • secondaryText - Text color on secondary background (#FFFFFF)

State Colors:

  • success - Success state color (#34C759)
  • warning - Warning state color (#FF9500)
  • error - Error state color (#FF3B30)
  • info - Info state color (#007AFF)

Interaction Colors:

  • link - Link color (#007AFF)
  • focus - Focus indicator color (#007AFF)
  • ripple - Ripple effect color (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1))

Disabled Colors:

  • disabled - Disabled element background (#E5E5EA)
  • disabledText - Disabled element text (#C7C7CC)

Overlay Colors:

  • backdrop - Backdrop/overlay color (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4))
  • shadow - Shadow color (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1))

Usage:

import { useTheme } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

function MyComponent() {
  const { colors } = useTheme();
  
  return (
    <View style={{ backgroundColor: colors.primary }}>
      <Text style={{ color: colors.primaryText }}>
        Primary Button
      </Text>
    </View>
  );
}

Spacing​

Consistent spacing scale for padding, margins, and gaps:

TokenValueUsage
none0No spacing
xs2Extra small spacing
s4Small spacing
sm8Small-medium spacing
md16Medium spacing (default)
lg24Large spacing
xl32Extra large spacing
xxl482x extra large
xxxl643x extra large
xxxxl804x extra large
xxxxxl965x extra large

Usage:

const { spacing } = useTheme();

<View style={{ padding: spacing.md, marginTop: spacing.lg }}>
  {/* Content */}
</View>

Radius​

Border radius values for rounded corners:

TokenValueUsage
none0Sharp corners
sm4Small radius (buttons, inputs)
md8Medium radius (cards, modals)
lg12Large radius (large cards)
xl16Extra large radius
pill9999Pill shape (fully rounded)

Usage:

const { radius } = useTheme();

<View style={{ borderRadius: radius.md }}>
  {/* Content */}
</View>

Shadows​

Elevation and shadow definitions for depth and hierarchy:

TokenElevationShadow OffsetShadow RadiusUsage
light2(0, 1)2Subtle elevation
thin3(0, 2)3Light cards
medium5(0, 4)6Modals, dialogs
thick8(0, 8)8Overlays
heavy12(0, 12)10Prominent elements

Usage:

const { shadows } = useTheme();

<View style={shadows.medium}>
  {/* Elevated content */}
</View>

Typography​

Text styles organized by category and size:

Paragraph Variants​

Small (paragraph.small):

  • regular - fontSize: 12, lineHeight: 18
  • bold - fontSize: 12, lineHeight: 18, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 12, lineHeight: 18, fontStyle: italic

Default (paragraph.default):

  • regular - fontSize: 16, lineHeight: 24
  • bold - fontSize: 16, lineHeight: 24, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 16, lineHeight: 24, fontStyle: italic

Large (paragraph.large):

  • regular - fontSize: 20, lineHeight: 30
  • bold - fontSize: 20, lineHeight: 30, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 20, lineHeight: 30, fontStyle: italic

Header Variants​

Small (header.small):

  • regular - fontSize: 18, lineHeight: 26
  • bold - fontSize: 18, lineHeight: 26, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 18, lineHeight: 26, fontStyle: italic

Default (header.default):

  • regular - fontSize: 24, lineHeight: 32
  • bold - fontSize: 24, lineHeight: 32, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 24, lineHeight: 32, fontStyle: italic

Large (header.large):

  • regular - fontSize: 32, lineHeight: 40
  • bold - fontSize: 32, lineHeight: 40, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 32, lineHeight: 40, fontStyle: italic

Label Variants​

  • regular - fontSize: 14, lineHeight: 20
  • bold - fontSize: 14, lineHeight: 20, fontWeight: 700
  • italic - fontSize: 14, lineHeight: 20, fontStyle: italic
  • small - fontSize: 12, lineHeight: 16

Usage:

const { typography } = useTheme();

<Text style={typography.header.large.bold}>
  Title
</Text>

<Text style={typography.paragraph.default.regular}>
  Body text
</Text>

Customizing the Theme​

You can customize the theme by passing a partial theme object to ThemeProvider:

import { ThemeProvider, createTheme } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

const customTheme = createTheme({
  colors: {
    primary: '#FF6B6B',
    secondary: '#4ECDC4',
  },
  spacing: {
    md: 20,
  },
});

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider value={customTheme}>
      {/* Your app */}
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}

The custom theme will be merged with the default theme using deep merge, so you only need to override the values you want to change.

Example: Dark Theme​

import { createTheme, ThemeProvider } from '@zaisustech/atomic-ui';

const darkTheme = createTheme({
  mode: 'dark',
  colors: {
    background: '#1A1A1A',
    surface: '#2D2D2D',
    card: '#2D2D2D',
    text: '#FFFFFF',
    textSecondary: '#B0B0B0',
    border: '#404040',
    divider: '#404040',
    primary: '#4ECDC4',
    primaryText: '#FFFFFF',
  },
});

function App() {
  return (
    <ThemeProvider value={darkTheme}>
      {/* Your app */}
    </ThemeProvider>
  );
}

Best Practices​

  1. Use semantic colors: Prefer semantic color tokens (primary, error, etc.) over raw color values or primitive colors
  2. Consistent spacing: Always use the spacing scale instead of arbitrary pixel values
  3. Typography variants: Use predefined typography variants instead of custom text styles
  4. Theme at root: Place ThemeProvider at the root of your application
  5. Type safety: The theme is fully typed, so TypeScript will help catch errors
  6. createTheme for customization: Use createTheme when creating custom themes to ensure type safety and proper merging

API Reference​

ThemeProvider​

type ThemeProviderProps = {
  children?: React.ReactNode;
  value?: Theme;
};

useTheme​

const useTheme = (): Theme;

Returns the current theme object. Throws an error if used outside of ThemeProvider.

createTheme​

createTheme(overrides?: Partial<Theme>): Theme

Creates a theme by merging the provided overrides with the default theme. Returns a complete Theme object.

defaultTheme​

const defaultTheme: Theme;

The default theme object used when no custom theme is provided.
